text: The Great Midwest Athletic Conference (G-MAC) Men's Basketball Tournament is the annual conference basketball championship tournament for the Great Midwest Athletic Conference. The tournament has been held annually since 2013. It is a single-elimination tournament and seeding is based on regular season records. The winner, declared conference champion, receives the conference's automatic bid to the NCAA Men's Division II Basketball Championship. ==Results== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Year !Champions !Score !Runner-Up !Venue |- align=center | 2013 |Cedarville |70–59 |Trevecca Nazarene |Callan Athletic Center (Cedarville, OH) |- align=center | 2014 |Alderson Broaddus |65–61 |Kentucky Wesleyan |Rex Pyles Arena (Philippi, WV) |- align=center | 2015 |Alderson Broaddus |50–47 |Kentucky Wesleyan |Rex Pyles Arena (Philippi, WV) |- align=center | 2016 |Kentucky Wesleyan |78–69 |Trevecca Nazarene |Owensboro Sportscenter (Owensboro, KY) |- align=center | 2017 |Kentucky Wesleyan |91–63 |Alderson Broaddus |Owensboro Sportscenter (Owensboro, KY) |- align=center | 2018 | Ohio Dominican | 71–53 | Hillsdale | Croy Gymnasium (Findlay, OH) |- align=center | 2019 | Walsh | 58-52 | Findlay | Croy Gymnasium (Findlay, OH) |- align=center | 2020 | Walsh | 69–48 | Kentucky Wesleyan | Croy Gymnasium (Findlay, OH) |} ==Championship records== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center;" |- !
